abstract.text: Returns the single-precision element-wise addition of the product of a vector and a scalar value, and a vector.

media-4387655.alt: A diagram showing the operation of this function. There are four rows. The top row represents the input vector A with three boxes, and the scalar value B with one box. The second row represents the operation that multiplies A and B, with three boxes, as well as the input vector C with three boxes. The third row represents the addition operation as three boxes. The bottom row represents the output vector D as three boxes. The diagram has connecting lines from the input vectors to the operations, and from the operations to the output vector.
